gurmukhi: ੴ> ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ||
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of the divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੧ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਦਾ ਪ੍ਰਯਾਲਾ
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of the divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸਚਾ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹੁ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹਾਂ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹ ਜੁਹਾਰੀ
transliteration: Satigur Sachaa Paatisaahu Paatisaahaan Paatisaahu Juhaaree.
translation: I salute the true Guru who is the true king of kings.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚਿਖੰਡੁ ਹੈ ਅਾੲਿ ਝਰੋਖੈ ਖੋਲੈ ਬਾਰੀ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Sachi Khandu Hai Aai Jharokhai Kholai Baaree.
translation: The Holy congregation is the abode of truth where the gates of mind are opened.

gurmukhi: ਅਮਿੳੁ ਕਿਰਣਿ ਨਿਝਰ ਝਰੈ ਅਨਹਦ ਨਾਦ ਵਾੲਿਨਿ ਦਰਬਾਰੀ
transliteration: Amiu Kirani Nijhar Jharai Anahad Naad Vaaini Darabaaree.
translation: The fountain of nectar flows here forever and the courtiers play the unstruck melody.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹਾਂ ਦੀ ਮਜਲਸੈ ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਪੀਵਣ ਭਾਰੀ
transliteration: Paatisaahaan Dee Majalasai Piramu Piaalaa Peevan Bhaaree.
translation: In the assembly of the kings it is very difficult to drink the cup of love.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਕੀ ਹੋੲਿ ਪੀਲਾਵਣਾ ੳੁਲਸ ਪਿਅਾਲੈ ਖਰੀ ਖੁਮਾਰੀ
transliteration: Saakee Hoi Peelaavanaa Ulas Piaalai Kharee Khoumaaree.
translation: The Guru becomes the beloved butler and makes one drink it, the delight of His tasted cup becomes multiplied.

gurmukhi: ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਭੈ ਚਲਣਾ ਮਸਤ ਅਲਮਸਤ ਸਦਾ ਹੁਸਿਅਾਰੀ
transliteration: Bhaai Bhagati Bhai Chalanaa Masat Alamasat Sadaa Housiaaree.
translation: Whosoever moves in the fear of loving devotion, he being carefree of the worldliness remains alert.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤ ਵਛਲ ਹੋੲਿ ਭਗਤ ਭੰਡਾਰੀ ||੧||
transliteration: Bhagat Vachhalu Hoi Bhagati Bhandaaree ?1?
translation: Kind to the devotees, God, becomes their caretaker and fulfils all their desires.

gurmukhi: ੨ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਸ਼੍ਰੁਤਿ ਦਾ ਭੇਦ ਜਰੋ
translation: Gurmukhs assimilate the mystery of spiritulism

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਤੁ ਨੁਕਤੈ ਹੋੲਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਮਹਰਮੁ ਮੁਜਰਮੁ ਖੈਰ ਖੁਅਾਰੀ
transliteration: Ikatu Noukatai Hoi Jaai Maharamu Mujaramu Khair Khuaaree.
translation: In Persian language only a point makes ‘mahram’ the confidant, a mujarim, the offender.

gurmukhi: ਮਸਤਾਨੀ ਵਿਚਿ ਮਸਲਤੀ ਗੈਰ ਮਹਲਿ ਜਾਣਾ ਮਨੁ ਮਾਰੀ
transliteration: Masataanee Vichi Masalatee Gair Mahali Jaanaa Manu Maaree.
translation: Gurmukhs remain exhilarated in the holy congregation and they do not like to go to other assemblies.

gurmukhi: ਗਲ ਨ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਨਿਕਲੈ ਹੁਕਮੀ ਬੰਦੇ ਕਾਰ ਕਰਾਰੀ
transliteration: Gal N Baahari Nikalai Houkamee Banday Kaar Karaaree.
translation: In the will of the Lord they serve vigorously and try not to make it public.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਪਿਰਮ ਰਸੁ ਦੇਹਿ ਬਿਦੇਹ ਵਡੇ ਵੀਚਾਰੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Dayhi Bidayh Vaday Veechaaree.
translation: Such gurmukhs attain the fruit of happiness and giving up the pride of body, and becoming bodiless they become serious thinkers.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦੁ ਸੁਣਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਅਾਸਣੁ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰੀ
transliteration: Gur Moorati Gur Sabadu Souni Saadhasangati Aasanu Nirankaaree.
translation: The word of the Guru is their idol and the holy congregation is the seat of the formless Lord.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਵੇਲਾ ਸਬਦੁ ਅਾਹਾਰੀ
transliteration: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Kari Anmritu Vaylaa Sabadu Aahaaree.
translation: Bowing before the primeval Purusa, in the ambrosial hours they chew the Word (gurbani).

gurmukhi: ਅਵਿਗਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਅਗਾਧ ਬੋਧਿ ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਅਸਗਾਹ ਅਪਾਰੀ
transliteration: Avigati Gati Agaadhi Bodhi Akad Kadaa Asagaah Apaaree.
translation: To have knowledge of the dynamism of that unmanifest Lord is a very deep experience, and to say something of that ineffable Lord is a Herculean task.

gurmukhi: ਸਹਨਿ ਅਵਟਣ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ ||੨||
transliteration: Sahani Avatanu Paraoupakaaree ?2?
translation: Only Gurmukhs suffer while doing good to others.

gurmukhi: ੩ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਕੳੁਣ ਸਦਾਵੇ
translation: Who may be called a Sikh of the Guru

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਜਨਮ ਸਕਾਰਥਾ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਮਿਲਿ ਗੁਰਸਰਣੀ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Janamu Sakaaradaa Gurasikh Mili Gurasaranee Aaiaa.
translation: The life of that gurmukh is fortunate whom meeting some Sikh of the Guru has come to the shelter of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਸਫਲ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Aadi Purakh Aadaysu Kari Saphal Moorati Guradarasanu Paaiaa.
translation: He bows before primeval Purusa (God) and becomes blessed after having the sight of such a Guru.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਦਖਣਾ ਡੰਡੳੁਤ ਕਰਿ ਮਸਤਕੁ ਚਰਣ ਕਮਲ ਗੁਰ ਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Paradakhanaa Dandaout Kari Masataku Charan Kaval Gur Laaiaa.
translation: After circumambulation he bows on the lotus feet of Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਪੁਰਖ ਦੲਿਅਾਲ ਹੋੲਿ ਵਾਹਿਗੁਰੂ ਸਚੁ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ੍ਰੁ ਸੁਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Satiguru Purakh Daiaalu Hoi Vaahiguroo Sachu Mantr Sounaaiaa.
translation: Becoming kind, the Guru recites true mantra Vaheguru for him.

gurmukhi: ਸਚ ਰਾਸਿ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਦੇ ਪੈਰੀਂ ਪੈ ਜਗੁ ਪੈਰੀ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sach Raasi Raharaasi Day Paireen Pai Jagu Pairee Paaiaa.
translation: The Sikh with his capital of devotion falls at the feet of Guru and the whole world bows at his feet.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਮੁ ਕਰੋਧੁ ਵਿਰੋਧੁ ਹਰਿ ਲੋਭੁ ਮੋਹੁ ਅਹੰਕਾਰੁ ਤਜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Kaam Karodhu Virodhu Hari Lobhu Mohu Ahankaaru Tajaaiaa.
translation: God (the Guru) eradicates his lust, anger and resistance and gets his greed, infatuation and ego erased.

gurmukhi: ਸਤੁ ਸੰਤੋਖੁ ਦੲਿਅਾ ਧਰਮੁ ਨਾਮੁ ਦਾਨੁ ੲਿਸਨਾਨੁ ਦ੍ਰਿੜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Satu Santokhu Daiaa Dharamu Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Drirhaaiaa.
translation: Instead, the Guru makes him practise truth, contentment, dharma, name, charity and ablution.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖਿ ਲੈ ਗੁਰਸਿਖੁ ਸਦਾੲਿਅਾ ||੩||
transliteration: Gur Sikh Lai Gurasikhu Sadaaiaa ?3?
translation: Adopting the teachings of the Guru, the individual is called a Sikh of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ੪ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ
translation: Gurmukh

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵਲੀਣੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚਿ ਮੇਲਿ ਮਿਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Livaleenu Hoi Saadhasangati Sachi Mayli Milaaiaa.
translation: Absorbing consciousness into the Word, the gurmukhs meet at the true meeting centre of the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਹੁਕਮ ਰਜਾੲੀ ਚਲਣਾ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਨ ਅਾਪੁ ਜਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Houkam Rajaaee Chalanaa Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Janaaiaa.
translation: They move in the will of the Lord and erasing their ego they do not make themselves to be noticed.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਅਾਵੇਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰਿ ਅਚਾਰਿ ਲੁਭਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Oupadays Avaysu Kari Paraoupakaari Achaari Loubhaaiaa.
translation: Inspired by the teachings of Guru they always remain eager to undertake the acts of public weal.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਅਪਿੳੁ ਪੀ ਸਹਜ ਸਮਾੲੀ ਅਜਰੁ ਜਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Piram Piaalaa Apiu Pee Sahaj Samaaee Ajaru Jaraaiaa.
translation: Quaffing the grand cup of the ineffable knowledge of the Lord and merging in equipoise, they bear the unbearable, ever-descending energy of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਮਿਠਾ ਬੋਲਣੁ ਨਿਵਿ ਚਲਣੁ ਹਥਹੁ ਦੇ ਕੈ ਭਲਾ ਮਨਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Mitdaa Bolanu Nivi Chalanu Hadahu Day Kai Bhalaa Manaaiaa.
translation: They speak sweetly, move humbly and giving donations wish everybody well.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਮਨਿ ੲਿਕੁ ਅਰਾਧਣਾ ਦੁਬਿਧਾ ਦੂਜਾ ਭਾੳੁ ਮਿਟਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Ik Mani Iku Araadhanaa Doubidhaa Doojaa Bhaau Mitaaiaa.
translation: Decimating their dubiety and sense of duality, they with single mind adore that One Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਨਿਜ ਪਦੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ ||੪||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Nij Padu Paaiaa ?4?
translation: Gurmukhs know themselves in the form of the fruit of delight and attain the supreme bliss.

gurmukhi: ੫ ਗੁਰ ਸਿੱਖੀ
translation: Sikhism

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਬਾਰੀਕ ਹੈ ਖੰਡੇ ਧਾਰ ਗਲੀ ਅਤਿ ਭੀੜੀ
transliteration: Gurasikhee Baareek Hai Khanday Dhaar Galee Ati Bheerhee.
translation: The discipleship of the Guru is very subtle like a sword edge and narrow alley.

gurmukhi: ਓਥੈ ਟਿਕੈ ਨ ਭੁਣਹਣਾ ਚਲਿ ਨ ਸਕੈ ੳੁਪਰਿ ਕੀੜੀ
transliteration: Aodai Tikai N Bhounahanaa Chali N Sakai Oupari Keerhee.
translation: Mosquito’s and ants cannot stand there.

gurmukhi: ਵਾਲਹੁੰ ਨਿਕੀ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਤੇਲੁ ਤਿਲਹੁੰ ਲੈ ਕੋਲ੍ਹੂ ਪੀੜੀ
transliteration: Vaalahu Nikee Aakheeai Taylu Tilahu Lai Kolh Peerhee.
translation: It is thinner than hair and as the oil of sesame is obtained after crushing it in the crusher with great difficulty, the discipleship of the Guru is not obtained easily.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਵੰਸੀ ਪਰਮਹੰਸ ਖੀਰ ਨੀਰ ਨਿਰਨੳੁ ਚੁੰਜਿ ਵੀੜੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Vansee Param Hans Kheer Neer Niranau Chounji Veerhee.
translation: Gurmukhs are descendants of swans and separate water from milk with their beak of thoughtfulness.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਲਾ ਅਲੂਣੀ ਚਟਣੀ ਮਾਣਕ ਮੋਤੀ ਚੋਗ ਨਿਵੀੜੀ
transliteration: Silaa Aloonee Chatanee Maanak Motee Chog Niveerhee.
translation: Like licking of the salt-less stone they pick up the rubies and jewels to eat.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਾਰਗਿ ਚਲਣਾ ਅਾਸ ਨਿਰਾਸੀ ਝੀੜ ੳੁਝੀੜੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Maaragi Chalanaa Aas Niraasee Jheerh Ujheerhee.
translation: The gurmukhs repudiating all hopes and desires move on the way of detachment and tear down the veil of Maya.

gurmukhi: ਸਹਜਿ ਸਰੋਵਰਿ ਸਚਖੰਡਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚ ਤਖਤਿ ਹਰੀੜੀ
transliteration: Sahaji Sarovari Sach Khandi Saadhasangati Sach Takhati Hareerhee.
translation: Holy congregation, the abode of truth and throne of the true Lord is the manasarovar for the gurmukhs.

gurmukhi: ਚੜ੍ਹਿ ੲਿਕੀਹ ਪਤਿ ਪੳੁੜੀਅਾ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰੁ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦੁ ਸਹੀੜੀ
transliteration: Charhhi Ikeeh Pati Paurheeaa Nirankaaru Gur Sabadu Saheerhee.
translation: Climbing the steps of non-duality they adopt the Word of the formless Guru.

gurmukhi: ਗੂੰਗੈ ਦੀ ਮਿਠਿਅਾੲੀਅੈ ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਵਿਸਮਾਦੁ ਬਚੀੜੀ
transliteration: Goungai Dee Mitdiaaeeai Akad Kadaa Visamaadu Bacheerhee.
translation: They enjoy His ineffable story like they enjoyment by a dumb person of the sweets.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਸਹਜਿ ਅਲੀੜੀ ||੫||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukhu Phalu Sahaji Aleerhee ?5?
translation: Through the natural devotion, the gurmukhs attain the fruit of delight.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਨ ਕਮਲ
translation: Lotus feet of Guru

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਪਿਰਮ ਰਸੁ ਚਰਣੋਦਕੁ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਣ ਪਖਾਲੇ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Piram Rasu Charanodaku Gur Charan Pakhaalay.
translation: Gurmukhs having the desire of the fruits of delight with all love wash the feet of the guru.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਖ ਸੰਪੁਟ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਖਿ ਕੈ ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਮਕਰੰਦ ਪਿਅਾਲੇ
transliteration: Soukh Sanpout Vichi Rakhi Kai Charan Kaval Makarand Piaalay.
translation: They make cups of the nectar of lotus feet and quaff it with complete delight.

gurmukhi: ਕੳੁਲਾਲੀ ਸੂਰਜ ਮੁਖੀ ਲਖ ਕਵਲ ਖਿੜਦੇ ਰਲੀਅਾਲੇ
transliteration: Kaulaalee Sooraj Moukhee Lakh Kaval Khirhaday Raleeaalay.
translation: Considering the feet of the Guru as sum they blossom like lotus.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦ੍ਰਮੁਖੀ ਹੁੲਿ ਕੁਮੁਦਨੀ ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਸੀਤਲ ਅਮੀਅਾਲੇ
transliteration: Chandr Moukhee Hui Koumudanee Charan Kaval Seetal Ameeaalay.
translation: Again becoming water lily attracted towards moon, they enjoy nectar from the lotus feet.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਦੀ ਵਾਸਨਾ ਲਖ ਸੂਰਜ ਹੋਵਨਿ ਅਲਿ ਕਾਲੇ
transliteration: Charan Kaval Dee Vaasanaa Lakh Sooraj Hovani Bhaur Kaalay.
translation: To have the fragrance of the lotus feet many suns become black bees.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਤਾਰੇ ਸੂਰਜਿ ਚੜ੍ਹੇ ਜਿੳੁ ਛਪਿ ਜਾਨਿ ਨ ਅਾਪ ਸਮ੍ਹਾਲੇ
transliteration: Lakh Taaray Sooraji Charhhi Jiu Chhapi Jaani N Aap Samhaalay.
translation: Wen the sun rises, myriad stars, unable to maintain themselves, hide.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਦਲ ਜੋਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਲਖ ਸੂਰਜਿ ਲੁਕਿ ਜਾਨਿ ਰਵਾਲੇ
transliteration: Charan Kaval Dal Joti Vichi Lakh Sooraji Louki Jaani Ravaalay.
translation: Likewise with the light of petals of lotus feet, myriad suns are concealed.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਲੈ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸੁਖਾਲੇ ||੬||
transliteration: Gur Sikh Lai Gurasikh Soukhaalay ?6?
translation: Receiving the teaching of the Guru, the disciples have themselves become the house of all pleasures.

gurmukhi: ੭ ੲੇਕਤਾ ਪਰ ਦ੍ਰਿਸ਼ਟਾਂਤ
translation: Example of unity

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਨ ੲਿਕ ਵਰਨ ਕਰਿ ਵਰਨ ਅਵਰਨ ਤਮੋਲ ਗੁਲਾਲੇ
transliteration: Chaari Varani Ik Varan Kari Varan Avaran Tamol Gulaalay.
translation: As in betel leaf all the colours mix and become one red colour, likewise mixing all the varnas one Sikh has been created.

gurmukhi: ਅਸਟ ਧਾਤੁ ੲਿਕੁ ਧਾਤੁ ਕਰਿ ਵੇਦ ਕਤੇਬ ਨ ਭੇਦੁ ਵਿਚਾਲੇ
transliteration: Asat Dhaatu Iku Dhaatu Kari Vayd Katayb N Bhaydu Vichaalay.
translation: Eight metals mixing up make one metal (alloy); similarly there is no difference among Vedas and the Katebas (the Semitic scriptures).

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਵਾਸੁ ਵਣਾਸੁਪਤਿ ਅਫਲ ਸਫਲ ਵਿਚਿ ਵਾਸੁ ਬਹਾਲੇ
transliteration: Chandan Vaasu Vanaasoupati Aphal Saphal Vichi Vaasu Bahaalay.
translation: The sandal perfumes the whole vegetation whether it is devoid of fruit or full of fruit.

gurmukhi: ਲੋਹਾ ਸੁੲਿਨਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੈ ਸੁੲਿਨਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਸੁਗੰਧਿ ਵਿਖਾਲੇ
transliteration: Lohaa Suinaa Hoi Kai Suinaa Hoi Sougandhi Vikhaalay.
translation: Touching the philosopher’s stone, iron becoming gold, again points towards its further beauty (of making itself useful for the needy ones).

gurmukhi: ਸੁੲਿਨੇ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਰੰਗ ਰਸ ਚਰਣਾਂਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਮਤਵਾਲੇ
transliteration: Suinay Andari Rang Ras Charanaamit Anmritu Matavaalay.
translation: Then in gold in the form of gurmukh, the colour (of Name) and elixir (of love) enter and he becomes carefree of the world around.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਣਕ ਮੋਤੀ ਸੁੲਿਨਿਅਹੁ ਜਗਮਗ ਜੋਤਿ ਹੀਰੇ ਪਰਵਾਲੇ
transliteration: Maanak Motee Suiniahu Jagamag Joti Heeray Paravaalay.
translation: Now all the qualities of rubies, pearls, diamonds emerge in that gold-gurmukh.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਬ ਦੇਹਿ ਦਿਬ ਦਿਸਟਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਦਿਬ ਜੋਤਿ ੳੁਜਾਲੇ
transliteration: Dib Dayh Dibadisati Hoi Sabad Surati Dibajoti Ujaalay.
translation: Becoming divine body and divine sight the consciousness of gurmukh concentrates on the light of the divine Word.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਰਸਿਕ ਰਸਾਲੇ ||੭||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Rasik Rasaalay ?7?
translation: Thus, adopting the delight of devotion, the gurmukhs become full of many delights.

gurmukhi: ੮ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਾਂ ਦੀ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਵਰਣਨ
translation: Love of the gurmukhs

gurmukhi: ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਸਾਧਸੰਗ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਅਨਹਦ ਲਿਵ ਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Piram Piaalaa Saadhasang Sabad Surati Anahad Liv Laaee.
translation: Quaffing the cup of love in the holy congregation, the Sikhs of Guru absorb their consciousness in the Word.

gurmukhi: ਧਿਅਾਨੀ ਚੰਦ ਚਕੋਰ ਗਤਿ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਸ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਵਰਸਾੲੀ
transliteration: Dhiaanee Chand Chakor Gati Anmrat Drisati Srisati Varasaaee.
translation: As the bird chakor meditates on moon to enjoy cool, from their sight also pours the nectar.

gurmukhi: ਘਨਹਰ ਚਾਤ੍ਰਿਕ ਮੋਰ ਜਿੳੁ ਅਨਹਦ ਧੁਨਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਪਾੲਿਲ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ghanahar Chaatrik Mor Jiu Anahad Dhouni Souni Paail Paaee.
translation: Listening to the roar of clouds they dance like rain bird and peacock.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਮਕਰੰਦ ਰਸਿ ਸੁਖ ਸੰਪੁਟ ਹੁੲਿ ਭਵਰੁ ਸਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Charan Kaval Makarand Rasi Soukh Sanpout Hui Bhavaru Samaaee.
translation: To taste the nectar of the lotus feet they turn themselves into the black bee and become one with the storehouse of delight (of the Lord).

gurmukhi: ਸੁਖ ਸਾਗਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਮੀਨ ਹੋੲਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਚਾਲਿ ਨ ਖੋਜ ਖੁਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Soukh Saagar Vichi Meen Hoi Guramoukhi Chaali N Khoj Khujaaee.
translation: The way of the gurmukhs is not known to anybody; similar to fish they live in the ocean of happiness.

gurmukhi: ਅਪਿਓ ਪੀਅਣੁ ਨਿਝਰ ਝਰਣ ਅਜਰੁ ਜਰਣ ਨਾ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲੀ
transliteration: Apiao Peeanu Nijhar Jharan Ajaru Jaran N Alakhu Lakhaaee.
translation: They drink nectar; from them gush forth the springs of nectar; they assimilate the unbearable but still they do not make them noticed by any one.

gurmukhi: ਵੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ੳੁਲੰਘਿ ਕੈ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Veeh Ikeeh Ulaghi Kai Gurasikh Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Paaee.
translation: Going across all the stages (of three-dimensional nature-prakarti) they attain the fruits of delights.

gurmukhi: ਵਾਹਿਗੁਰੂ ਵਡੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ||੮||
transliteration: Vaahiguroo Vadee Vadiaaee ?8?
translation: Wondrous is the Vaheguru whose greatness is grand.

gurmukhi: ੯ ਗੁਰੂ ਪ੍ਰੀਤੀ
translation: Love for the Guru

gurmukhi: ਕਛੂ ਅਾਂਡਾ ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ਧਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਪਰਪਕੁ ਨਦੀ ਵਿਚਿ ਅਾਣੈ
transliteration: Kachhoo Aandaa Dhiaanu Dhari Kari Parapaku Nadee Vichi Aanai.
translation: Tortoise lays its eggs in the sands but having full care of them on their maturity, it brings them into the river.

gurmukhi: ਕੂੰਜ ਰਿਦੈ ਸਿਮਰਣੁ ਕਰੈ ਲੈ ਬਚਾ ੳੁਡਦੀ ਅਸਮਾਣੈ
transliteration: Koonj Ridai Simaranu Karai Lai Bachaa Udadee Asamaanai.
translation: The florican also under its full care makes its off spring fly in the sky.

gurmukhi: ਬਤਕ ਬਚਾ ਤੁਰਿ ਤੁਰਾ ਜਲ ਥਲ ਵਰਤੈ ਸਹਜਿ ਵਿਡਾਣੈ
transliteration: Batak Bachaa Turi Turai Jal Dal Varatai Sahaji Vidaanai.
translation: The swan also in its very natural way teaches its young ones to move on water as well as on earth.

gurmukhi: ਕੋੲਿਲ ਪਾਲੈ ਕਾਵਣੀ ਮਿਲਦਾ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੁਟੰਬ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਣੈ
transliteration: Koil Paalai Kaavanee Miladaa Jaai Koutanbi Siaanai.
translation: The crow maintains the offspring’s of cuckoo but as and when they grow up, they, identifying the voice of their mother, go and meet her.

gurmukhi: ਹੰਸ ਵੰਸੁ ਵਸਿ ਮਾਨਸਰਿ ਮਾਣਕ ਮੋਤੀ ਚੋਗ ਚੁਗਾਣੈ
transliteration: Hans Vansu Vasi Maanasari Maanak Motee Chog Chougaanai.
translation: The progeny of swans learn to pick up pearls while living in the Manasarovar, the sacred tank.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਨਿ ਧਿਅਾਨਿ ਸਿਮਰਣਿ ਸਦਾ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੁ ਰਖੈ ਨਿਰਬਾਣੈ
transliteration: Giaan Dhiaani Simarani Sadaa Satiguru Sikhu Rakhai Nirabaanai.
translation: Giving the technique of knowledge, meditation and remembrance to the Sikh, the Guru liberates him forever.

gurmukhi: ਭੂਤ ਭਵਿਖਹੁਂ ਵਰਤਮਾਨ ਤ੍ਰਿਭਵਣ ਸੋਝੀ ਮਾਣੁ ਨਿਮਾਣੈ
transliteration: Bhooh Bhavikhahu Varatamaan Tribhavan Sojhee Maanu Nimaanai.
translation: The Sikh now knows the future, present and past but he gets honours by becoming humble.

gurmukhi: ਜਾਤੀ ਸੁੰਦਰ ਲੋਕੁ ਨ ਜਾਣੈ ||੯||
transliteration: Jaatee Soundar Loku N Jaanai ?9?
translation: The ilk of the gurmukhs is grand but people do not know this fact.

gurmukhi: ੧੦ ਗੁਰ ਸਿੱਖ ਦੀ ਵਿਸ਼ੇਖਤਾ
translation: Especiality of the Sikh of Guru

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਵਾਸ ਵਣਾਸਪਤਿ ਬਾਵਨ ਚੰਦਨਿ ਚੰਦਨ ਹੋੲੀ
transliteration: Chandan Vaasu Vanaasapati Baavan Chandani Chandanu Hoee.
translation: With the fragrance of sandalwood the whole vegetation becomes sandal.

gurmukhi: ਫਲ ਵਿਣੁ ਚੰਦਨੁ ਬਾਵਨਾ ਅਾਦਿ ਅਨਾਦਿ ਬਿਅੰਤੁ ਸਦੋੲੀ
transliteration: Phal Vinu Chandanu Baavanaa Aadi Anaadi Biantu Sadoee.
translation: Though itself the sandal is without fruit but it is always considered as costly.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨੁ ਬਾਵਨ ਚੰਦਨਹੁਂ ਚੰਦਨ ਵਾਸੁ ਨ ਚੰਦਨੁ ਕੋੲੀ
transliteration: Chandanu Baavan Chandanahu Chandan Vaasu N Chandanu Koee.
translation: But the plant, which becomes sandal through the fragrance of sandal, cannot make any other plant sandal.

gurmukhi: ਅਸਟੁਧਾਤੁ ੲਿਕੁ ਧਾਤੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਪਾਰਸ ਪਰਸੇ ਕੰਚਨ ਜੋੲੀ
transliteration: Asatudhaatu Iku Dhaatu Hoi Paaras Parasay Kanchanu Joee.
translation: Eight metals touching the philosopher’s stone becomes gold but that gold cannot produce further gold.

gurmukhi: ਕੰਚਨ ਹੋੲਿ ਨ ਕੰਚਨਹੁਂ ਵਰਤਮਾਨ ਵਰਤੈ ਸਭਿ ਲੋੲੀ
transliteration: Kanchan Hoi N Kanchanahu Varatamaan Varatai Sabhi Loee.
translation: All this is performed in the present only (but the Sikh of Guru makes many like himself; they further become competent to transform others into a Sikh way of life).

gurmukhi: ਨਦੀਅਾਂ ਨਾਲੇ ਗੰਗ ਸੰਗਿ ਸਾਗਰ ਸੰਗਮਿ ਖਾਰਾ ਸੋੲੀ
transliteration: Nadeeaa Naalay Gang Sangi Saagar Sangami Khaaraa Soee.
translation: Rivers, streams and even the Ganges become brackish in the company of ocean.

gurmukhi: ਬਗੁਲਾ ਹੰਸੁ ਨ ਹੋਵੲੀ ਮਾਨ ਸਰੋਵਰ ਜਾੲਿ ਖਲੋੲੀ
transliteration: Bagulaa Hansu N Hovaee Maan Sarovari Jaai Khaloee.
translation: The crane never becomes swan even if it sits at Manasarovar.

gurmukhi: ਵੀਹਾਂ ਦੈ ਵਰਤਾਰੈ ਓੲੀ ||੧੦||
transliteration: Veehaan Dai Varataarai Aoee ?10?
translation: It so happens because an ordinary person remains always involved in the counts of twenties and more i.e. money.

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ਤਥਾ ਦ੍ਰਿਸਸ਼ਟਾਂਤ
translation: More examples

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ੲਿਕੀਹ ਪੌੜੀਅਾਂ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਭੋੲੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Ikeeh Paurheeaan Guramoukhi Soukhaphalu Nij Ghari Bhoee.
translation: Crossing the stairs of identities, the gurmukh under the guidance of the Guru comes to reside in his own true nature.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਹੈ ਸਹਜ ਘਰਿ ਸਿਮਰਣੁ ਦਰਸਿ ਪਰਸਿ ਗੁਣ ਗੋੲੀ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Hai Sahaj Ghari Simaranu Darasi Parasi Goun Goee.
translation: Holy congregation, the source of remembrance of the Lord, His sight and touch, is the abode of equipoise.

gurmukhi: ਲੋਹਾ ਸੁੲਿਨਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੈ ਸੁੲਿਨਿਅਹੁਂ ਸੁੲਿਨਾ ਜਿੳੁਂ ਅਵਿਲੋੲੀ
transliteration: Lohaa Suinaa Hoi Kai Suiniahu Suinaa Jioun Aviloee.
translation: Holy congregation is such a gold whose ingredients i.e. people therein, once known fir their qualities of iron have now become gold and are seen as gold.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨੁ ਬੋਹੈ ਨਿੰਮੁ ਵਣੁ ਨਿੰਮਹੁ ਚੰਦਨੁ ਬਿਰਖੁ ਪਲੋੲੀ
transliteration: Chandanu Bohai Nimu Vanu Nimahu Chandanu Birakhu Paloee.
translation: Even margosa tree, Azadirachta indica, becomes sandal in the company of sandal tree.

gurmukhi: ਗੰਗੋਦਕ ਚਰਣੋਦਕਹੁਂ ਗੰਗੋਦਕ ਮਿਲਿ ਗੰਗਾ ਹੋੲੀ
transliteration: Gangodak Charanodakahu Gangodak Mili Gangaa Hoee.
translation: Water made dirty by feet also becomes pure when it meets the Ganges.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਗਹੁੰ ਹੰਸੁ ਸੁਵੰਸੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਹੰਸਹੁਂ ਪਰਮ ਹੰਸੁ ਵਿਰਲੋੲੀ
transliteration: Kaagahu Hansu Suvansu Hoi Hansahu Param Hansu Viraloee.
translation: Any crow of good breed may become swan but rare is the swan, which becomes supreme swan of rare and highest order.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਵੰਸੀ ਪਰਮਹੰਸੁ ਕੂੜ ਸਚੁ ਨੀਰੁ ਖੀਰੁ ਵਿਲੋੲੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Vansee Param Hansu Koorhu Sachu Neeru Kheeru Viloee.
translation: Born in the family of gurmukh is the paramhans (man of highest spiritual order), who separate milk and water of truth and falsehood by his discerning wisdom.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਚੇਲਾ ਚੇਲਾ ਗੁਰ ਹੋੲੀ ||੧੧||
transliteration: Gur Chaylaa Chaylaa Gur Hoee ?11?
translation: (In the holy congregation) the disciple is the Guru and the Guru (most humbly) becomes disciple.

gurmukhi: ੧੨ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਸੰਧੀ
translation: Wisdom of Gurmukhs

gurmukhi: ਕਛੂ ਬਚਾ ਨਦੀ ਵਿਚਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਲਹਰਿ ਨ ਭਵਜਲ ਬਿਅਾਪੈ
transliteration: Kachhoo Bachaa Nadee Vichi Gurasikh Lahari N Bhavajalu Biaapai.
translation: As the offspring of tortoise are not affected by sea waves so is the case of the Sikhs of Guru; they are not influenced by the waves of the World Ocean.

gurmukhi: ਕੂੰਜ ਬਚਾ ਲੈੲਿ ੳੁਡਰੈ ਸੁੰਨਿ ਸਮਾਧਿ ਅਗਾਧਿ ਨ ਜਾਪੈ
transliteration: Koonj Bachaa Laii Udarai Sounni Samaadhi Agaadhi N Jaapai.
translation: Florican bird flies comfortably along with its offspring in the sky but the sky does not look abysmal to it.

gurmukhi: ਹੰਸੁ ਵੰਸੁ ਹੈ ਮਾਨਸਰਿ ਸਹਜ ਸਰੋਵਰਿ ਵਡ ਪਰਤਾਪੈ
transliteration: Hansu Vansu Hai Maanasari Sahaj Sarovari Vad Parataapai.
translation: The progeny of swans reside in the all potent Manasarovar.

gurmukhi: ਬਤਕ ਬਚਾ ਕੋੲਿਲੈ ਨੰਦ ਨੰਦਨ ਵਾਸੁਦੇਵ ਮਿਲਾਪੈ
transliteration: Batak Bachaa Koilai Nad Nadan Vasudayv Milaapai.
translation: The goose and nightingale separate their progeny from hens and crows respectively and though living among milkman Krishna ultimately went to Vasudev; likewise, the gurmukh giving up all the evil propensities goes to merge in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਰਵਿ ਸਸਿ ਚਕਵੀ ਤੈ ਚਕੋਰ ਸਿਵ ਸਕਤੀ ਲੰਘਿ ਵਰੈ ਸਰਾਪੈ
transliteration: Ravi Sasi Chakavee Tai Chakor Siv Sakatee Laghi Varai Saraapai.
translation: As the female ruddy sheldrake and redlegged partridge meet sun and moon respectively gurmukh also crossing the maya of Siva and Sakti attains the highest state of equipoise.

gurmukhi: ਅਨਲ ਪੰਖਿ ਬਚਾ ਮਿਲੈ ਨਿਰਾਧਾਰ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਮਝੈ ਅਾਪੈ
transliteration: Anal Pankhi Bachaa Milai Niraadhaar Hoi Samajhai Aapai.
translation: The anal bird recognises its offspring even without any basis for its identification.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸੰਧਿ ਮਿਲਾਵਣੀ ਸਬਦੁ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਪਰਚਾੲਿ ਪਛਾਪੈ
transliteration: Gurasikh Sandhi Milaavanee Sabadu Surati Parachaai Pachhaapai.
translation: It is the state of Sikh who merging his consciousness in the Word, identifies the true love (of the Lord).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਥਾਪਿ ੳੁਥਾਪੈ ||੧੨||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Daapi Udaapai ?12?
translation: The gurmukhs identify and establish the fruits of delight.

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਸਿੱਖ ਨਾਮਾਵਲੀ
translation: Inventory of the names of the Sikhs of Guru Nanak

gurmukhi: ਤਾਰੂ ਪੋਪਟੁ ਤਾਰਿਅਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਬਾਲ ਸੁਭਾੲਿ ੳੁਦਾਸੀ
transliteration: Taaroo Popatoo Taariaa Guramoukhi Baal Soubhaai Udaasee.
translation: From the very childhood Guru Nanak) liberated detached natured Taru, a Sikh of popat clan.

gurmukhi: ਮੂਲਾ ਕੀੜੁ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਚਲਿਤੁ ਅਚਰਜ ਲੁਭਿਤ ਗੁਰਦਾਸੀ
transliteration: Moolaa Keerhu Vakhaaneeai Chalitu Acharaj Loubhit Guradaasee.
translation: One Mula of a wonderful nature was there; he would conduct as the servant of the servants of Guru.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਰਥਾ ਖੇਡਾ ਸੋੲਿਰੀ ਚਰਣ ਸਰਣ ਸੁਖ ਸਹਜਿ ਨਿਵਾਸੀ
transliteration: Piradaa Khaydaa Soiree Charan Saran Soukh Sahaji Nivaasee.
translation: Pirtha and Kheda of soiri caste also got merged in equipoise because of the shelter of the feet of Guru.

gurmukhi: ਭਲਾ ਰਬਾਬ ਵਜਾੲਿੰਦਾ ਮਜਲਸ ਮਰਦਾਨਾ ਮੀਰਾਸੀ
transliteration: Bhalaa Rabaab Vajaaindaa Majalas Maradaanaa Meeraasee.
translation: Mardana, the bard and witty person and a good player of Rabab in assemblies was a disciple of Guru Nanak.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਰਥੀ ਮਲੁ ਸਹਗਲੁ ਭਲਾ ਰਾਮਾ ਡਿਡੀ ਭਗਤਿ ਅਭਿਅਾਸੀ
transliteration: Piradee Malu Sahagalu Bhalaa Raamaa Didee Bhagati Abhiaasee.
translation: Pirthi Malu of Sahagalu caste and Rama, (the devotee of Didi caste) were of detached nature.

gurmukhi: ਦੳੁਲਤ ਖਾਂ ਲੋਦੀ ਭਲਾ ਹੋਅਾ ਜਿੰਦ ਪੀਰੁ ਅਬਿਨਾਸੀ
transliteration: Daulat Khaan Lodee Bhalaa Hoaa Jind Peeru Abinaasee.
translation: Daulat Khan Lodhi was a nice person who later came to be known as a living pir, the spiritualist.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਲੋ ਮਾਂਗਾ ਸਿਖ ਦੁੲਿ ਗੁਰਬਾਣੀ ਰਸਿ ਰਸਿਕ ਬਿਲਾਸੀ
transliteration: Maalo Maangaa Sikh Dui Gurabaanee Rasi Rasik Bilaasee.
translation: Malo and Manga were two Sikhs who would remain always absorbed in the joy of Gurbani, the holy hymns.

gurmukhi: ਸਨਮੁਖਿ ਕਾਲੂ ਅਾਸ ਧਾਰ ਗੁਰਬਾਣੀ ਦਰਗਹ ਸਾਬਾਸੀ
transliteration: Sanamoukhi Kaaloo Aas Dhaar Gurabaanee Daragah Saabaasee.
translation: Kalu, the Kshtriya, having many wishes and desires in his heart came to the Guru and under the influence of Gurbani, got regards in the court of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਪਰਗਾਸੀ ||੧੩||
transliteration: Guramati Bhaau Bhagati Paragaasee ?13?
translation: The wisdom of the Guru, i.e. the Gurmat, spread the loving devotion all round.

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ਸਿਖ ਨਾਮ ਮਾਲਾ
translation: Sikh name inventory

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤੁ ਜੋ ਭਗਤਾ ਓਹਰੀ ਜਾਪੂਵੰਸੀ ਸੇਵ ਕਮਾਵੈ
transliteration: Bhagatu Jo Bhagataa Aoharee Jaapoovansee Sayv Kamaavai.
translation: A devotee named Bhagata if Ohari caste and Bhagat of Japuvansi family were two sikhs that served the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸੀਹਾਂ ੳੁਪਲੁ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਗਜਣੁ ੳੁਪਲੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਭਾਵੈ
transliteration: Seehaan Oupalu Jaaneeai Gajanu Oupalu Satigur Bhaavai.
translation: Sihan, the Uppal, and another devotee of Uppal caste were very dear to the true Guru.

gurmukhi: ਮੈਲਸੀਹਾਂ ਵਿਚਿ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਭਾਗੀਰਥੁ ਕਾਲੀ ਗੁਣ ਗਾਵੈ
transliteration: Mailaseehaan Vichi Aakheeai Bhaageeradu Kaalee Goun Gaavai.
translation: One Bhagirath of  Malsihan town was there who earlier was a devotee of Kali,  the goddess.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਤਾ ਰੰਧਾਵਾ ਭਲਾ ਹੈ ਬੂੜਾ ਬੁਢਾ ੲਿਕ ਮਨਿ ਧਿਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Jitaa Randhaavaa Bhalaa Hai Boorhaa Buddhaa Ik Mani Dhiaavai.
translation: Jita of Randhava was also a fine Sikh and Bhai Budda, whose earlier name was Bura, would remember the Lord with single devotion.

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰਣਾ ਖਹਿਰਾ ਜੋਧੁ ਸਿਖੁ ਜੀਵਾੲੀ ਗੁਰੁ ਸੇਵ ਸਮਾਵੈ
transliteration: Dhiranaa Khahiraa Jodhu Sikhu Jeevaaee Gur Sayv Samaavai.
translation: Bhai Phirana  of Khaira caste, Jodh and Jiva always remained absorbed in the service of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਜਰੁ ਜਾਤਿ ਲੁਹਾਰੁ ਹੈ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੀ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸੁਣਾਵੈ
transliteration: Gujaru Jaati Luhaaru Hai Gur Sikhee Gurasikh Sounaavai.
translation: One Lohar caste Sikh named Gujjar was there who preached Sikhism to the Sikhs of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਨਾੲੀ ਧਿੰਙ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਿ ਕੁਟੰਬੁ ਤਰਾਵੈ
transliteration: Naaee Dhioun Vakhaaneeai Satigur Sayvi Koutanbu Taraavai.
translation: Dhinga, the barber, serving the Guru got his whole family liberated.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਅਲਖ ਲਖਾਵੈ ||੧੪||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakhu Lakhaavai ?14?
translation: The gurmukhs having sight of the Lord themselves, make others also to have the same glimpse.

gurmukhi: ੧੫ ਸਿੱਖ ਨਾਮਾਵਲੀ
translation: Sikhs of the second Guru

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰੋ ਜੁਲਕਾ ਪਰਮਹੰਸੁ ਪੂਰੈ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਧਾਰੀ
transliteration: Paaro Julakaa Paramahansu Pooray Satigur Kirapaa Dhaaree.
translation: A sikh of high order (paramhans) Bhai Paro was there of Julka caste on whom the Guru was full of grace.

gurmukhi: ਮਲੂਸਾਹੀ ਸੂਰਮਾ ਵਡਾ ਭਗਤੁ ਭਾੲੀ ਕੇਦਾਰੀ
transliteration: Maloosaahee Sooramaa Vadaa Bhagatu Bhaaee Kaydaaree.
translation: Sikh named Mallu was very brave and Bhai Kedara was a great devotee.

gurmukhi: ਦੀਪਾ ਦੇੳੂੂ ਨਰਾੲਿਣ ਦਾਸੁ ਬੂਲੇ ਦੇ ਜਾੲੀਅੈ ਬਲਿਹਾਰੀ
transliteration: Deepaa Dayoo Naraainadaasu Boolay Day Jaaeeai Balihaaree.
translation: I am sacrifice unto Bhai Dev , Bhai Naryan Das, Bhai Bula and Bhai Dipa.

gurmukhi: ਲਾਲ ਸੁ ਲਾਲੂ ਬੁਧਿਵਾਨ ਦੁਰਗਾ ਜੀਵੰਧੁ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ
transliteration: Laal Su Laaloo Budhivaan Duragaa Jeevan Paraoupakaaree.
translation: Bhai Lalu, Bhai Durga and Jivanda were gems among the wisemen and, all three were altruists.

gurmukhi: ਜਗਾ ਧਰਣੀ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਸੰਸਾਰੂ ਨਾਲੇ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰੀ
transliteration: Jagaa Dharanee Jaaneeai Sansaaroo Naalay Nirankaaree.
translation: Jagga and Dharani subcaste and Sansaru was one with the formless Lord.

gurmukhi: ਖਾਨੂ ਮਾੲੀਅਾ ਪਿੳੁ ਪੁਤ ਹੈਂ ਗੁਣ ਗਾਹਕ ਗੋਵਿੰਦ ਭੰਡਾਰੀ
transliteration: Khaanoo Maaeeaa Piu Poutu Hain Goun Gaahak Govind Bhandaaree.
translation: Khanu and Mayya were father and son and Govind of Bhandari sub caste was an appreciator of the meritorious ones.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਧੁ ਰਸੋੲੀਅਾ ਦੇਵਤਾ ਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਾ ਕਰਿ ਦੁਤਰ ਤਾਰੀ
transliteration: Jodhu Rasoeeaa Dayvataa Gur Sayvaa Kari Doutaru Taaree.
translation: Jodh, the cook, served the Guru and swam across the world ocean.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰੈ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪੈਜ ਸਵਾਰੀ ||੧੫||
transliteration: Pooray Satigur Paij Savaaree ?15?
translation: The perfect Guru maintained their honour.

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ਡੱਲੇ ਵਾਸੀ ਸੰਗਤ
translation: Dalla assembly of the third Guru

gurmukhi: ਪਿਰਥੀ ਮਲ ਤੁਲਸਾ ਭਲਾ ਮਲਣ ਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਾ ਹਿਤਕਾਰੀ
transliteration: Piradee Malu Tulasaa Bhalaa Malanu Gur Sayvaa Hitakaaree.
translation: Pirathi  Mal, Tulasa and Malhan were devoted to the service of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮੂ ਦੀਪਾ ੳੁਗ੍ਰਸੈਣੁ ਨਾਗੳੁਰੀ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਵੀਚਾਰੀ
transliteration: Raamoo Deepaa Ougrasainu Naagauree Gur Sabad Veechaaree.
translation: Ramu, Dipa, Ugarsain, Nagori would concentraye opon the world of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਮੋਹਣ ਰਾਮੂ ਮਹਤਿਅਾ ਅਮਰੂ ਗੋਪੀ ਹੳੁਮੈ ਮਾਰੀ
transliteration: Mohanu Raamoo Mahatiaa Amaroo Gopee Haoumai Maaree.
translation: Mohan, Ramu, the Mehta, Amaru and Gopi had erased their sense of ego.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਾਰੂ ਗੰਗੂ ਭਲੇ ਭਾਗੂ ਭਗਤੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਹੈ ਪਿਅਾਰੀ
transliteration: Saahaaroo Gangoo Bhalay Bhaagoo Bhagatu Bhagati Hai Piaaree.
translation: To Saharu and Gangu of Bhalla caste and to Bhagu, the devotee, the devotion of the Lord was very dear.

gurmukhi: ਖਾਨੁ ਛੁਰਾ ਤਾਰੂ ਤਰੇ ਵੇਗਾ ਪਾਸੀ ਕਰਣੀ ਸਾਰੀ
transliteration: Khaanu Chhuraa Taaroo Taray Vaygaa Paasee Karanee Saaree.
translation: Khanu, Chhura, Taru, had swum (the world ocean).

gurmukhi: ੳੁਗਰੂ ਨੰਦੂ ਸੂਦਨਾ ਪੂਰੋ ਝੰਟਾ ਪਾਰਿ ੳੁਤਾਰੀ
transliteration: Ougaroo Nadoo Soodanaa Pooro Jhataa Paari Outaaree.
translation: Khanu, Chhura, Taru, had swum (the world ocean).

gurmukhi: ਮਲੀਅਾ ਸਾਹਾਰੂ ਭਲੇ ਛੀਂਬੇ ਗੁਰ ਦਰਗਹ ਦਰਬਾਰੀ
transliteration: Maleeaa Saahaaroo Bhalay Chheenbay Gur Daragah Darabaaree.
translation: Many Courtiers of the Gurus court such as Mallia, Saharu, Bhallas and calico-printers have happened.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਂਧਾ ਬੂਲਾ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਗੁਰਬਾਣੀ ਗਾੲਿਣੁ ਲੇਖਾਰੀ
transliteration: Paandhaa Boolaa Jaaneeai Gurabaanee Gaainu Laykhaaree.
translation: Pandha and Bula are known as the singer and the writer of the hymns of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਡਲੇ ਵਾਸੀ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਭਾਰੀ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Dalay Vaasee Sangati Bhaaree ?16?
translation: Grand was the assemblage of Dalla inhabitants.

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਸੱਭਰ ਵਾਲ ਦੇ ਸਿੱਖ
translation: Sabharval Sikhs of the fourth Guru

gurmukhi: ਸਨਮੁਖ ਭਾੲੀ ਤੀਰਥਾ ਸਭਰਵਾਲ ਸਭੇ ਸਿਰਦਾਰਾ
transliteration: Sanamoukh Bhaaee Teeradaa Sabharavaal Sabhay Siradaaraa.
translation: Bhai Tirtha was the leaderamong all the Sikhs of Sabharval sub- caste.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰੋ ਮਾਣਕ ਚੰਦੁ ਹੈ ਬਿਸਨ ਦਾਸੁ ਪਰਵਾਰ ਸਧਾਰਾ
transliteration: Pooro Maanak Chandu Hai Bisanadaasu Paravaar Sadhaaraa.
translation: Bhai Piro, Manik Chjand and Bisan Das have become base of the whole family i.e. they have got liberated the whole family.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਰਖੁ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਤਾਰੂ ਭਾਰੂ ਦਾਸੁ ਦੁਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Purakhu Padaarad Jaaneeai Taaroo Bhaaroo Daasu Duaaraa.
translation: Taru, Bharu Das, the Sikhs at the door of the Guru are held as ideals for all the Sikhs.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾਂ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਹੈ ਮਹਾਂ ਨੰਦੁ ਬਿਧੀ ਚੰਦ ਬੁਧਿ ਬਿਮਲ ਵੀਚਾਰਾ
transliteration: Mahaan Purakhu Hai Mahaanadu Bidheechand Budhi Bimal Veechaaraa.
translation: Mahanand is a great man and Bidhi Chand has a pious wisdom.

gurmukhi: ਬਰ੍ਹਮ ਦਾਸੁ ਹੈ ਖੋਟੜਾ ਡੂੰਗਰੁ ਦਾਸੁ ਭਲੇ ਤਕਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Barham Daas Hai Khotarhaa Doongaru Daasu Bhalay Takiaaraa.
translation: Braham Das is of Khotra caste and Dungar Das is known as Bhalla.

gurmukhi: ਦੀਪਾ ਜੇਠਾ ਤੀਰਥਾ ਸੈਸਾਰੂ ਬੂਲਾ ਸਚਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Deepaa Jaytdaa Teeradaa Saisaaroo Boolaa Sachiaaraa.
translation: Other are Dipa, jetha,Tiratha, Saisaru and Bula whose conduct is truthful.

gurmukhi: ਮਾੲੀਅਾ ਜਾਪਾ ਜਾਣੀਅਨਿ ਨੲੀਅਾ ਖੁਲਰੁ ਗੁਰੂ ਪਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Maaeeaa Jaapaa Jaaneeani Naeeaa Khular Guroo Piaaraa.
translation: Maia, Japa and Naia  are known to come from Khullar sub-caste .

gurmukhi: ਤੁਲਸਾ ਵਹੁਰਾ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ ਅਵੇਸ ਅਚਾਰਾ
transliteration: Tulasaa Vahuraa Jaaneeai Gur Oupadays Avays Achaaraa.
translation: Tulasa Bohra is known as inspired by the teachings of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਚੁ ਸਵਾਰਣ ਹਾਰਾ ||੧੭||
transliteration: Satigur Sachu Savaaranahaaraa ?17?
translation: The true Guru alone chisels one and all.

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਪ੍ਰਯਾਰੇ ਸਿੱਖ
translation: The Sikhs of the fifth Guru

gurmukhi: ਪੁਰੀਅਾ ਚੂਹੜੁ ਚੳੁਧਰੀ ਪੈੜਾ ਦਰਗਹ ਦਾਤਾ ਭਾਰਾ
transliteration: Pureeaa Chooharhu Chaudharee Pairhaa Daragah Daataa Bhaaraa.
translation: Bhai puria, Chaudhari Chuhar, Bhai Paira and Durga Das are known for their charitable nature.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਲਾ ਕਿਸਨਾ ਝਿੰਗਰਣਿ ਪੰਡਿਤ ਰਾੲਿ ਸਭਾ ਸੀਗਾਰਾ
transliteration: Baalaa Kisanaa Jhingarani Pandit Raai Sabhaa Seegaaraa.
translation: Bala and Kisana of Jhigran caste adore the assemblies of wise men.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹੜੁ ਤਿਲੋਕਾ ਸੂਰਮਾ ਸਿਖੁ ਸਮੁੰਦਾ ਸਨਮੁਖੁ ਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Suharhu Tilokaa Sooramaa Sikhu Samoundaa Sanamoukhu Saaraa.
translation: Brave is Tiloko of Suhar caste and Samunda, another Sikh, always remains before the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਲਾ ਭੁਲਾ ਝੰਝੀਅਾ ਭਾਗੀਰਥੁ ਸੁੲਿਨੀ ਸਚਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Kulaa Bhulaa Jhanjheeaa Bhaageeradu Suinee Sachiaaraa.
translation: Bhai Kulla and Bhai Bhulla of Jhanji caste, and Bhai Bhagirath of Soni caste maintain a truthful conduct.

gurmukhi: ਲਾਲੂ ਬਾਲੂ ਵਿਜ ਹਨਿ ਹਰਖਵੰਤੁ ਹਰਿਦਾਸ ਪਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Laaloo Baaloo Vij Hani Harakhavantu Haridaas Piaaraa.
translation: Lau and Balu are Vij and Haridas remains always happy.

gurmukhi: ਧੀਰੁ ਨਿਹਾਲੂ ਤੁਲਸੀਅਾ ਬੂਲਾ ਚੰਡੀਅਾ ਬਹੁ ਗੁਣਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Dheeru Nihaaloo Tulaseeaa Boolaa Chandeeaa Bahu Gouniaaraa.
translation: Nihalu and Tulsia are for bearing and Bula Chandia are full of many virtues.

gurmukhi: ਗੋਖੂ ਟੋਡਾ ਮਹਤਿਅਾ ਤੋਤਾ ਮਦੂ ਸਬਦ ਵੀਚਾਰਾ
transliteration: Gokhoo Taydaa Mahatiaa Totaa Madoo Sabad Veechaaraa.
translation: TodaTota and Maddu  from Mehta family of Gokha city are contemplator of the Word of Guru.

gurmukhi: ਝਾਂਝੂ ਅਤੇ ਮੁਕੰਦੁ ਹੈ ਕੀਰਤਨ ਕਰੈ ਹਜੂਰ ਕਿਦਾਰਾ
transliteration: Jhaanjhoo Atay Moukandu Hai Keeratanu Karai Hajoori Kidaaraa.
translation: Jhanju, Mukand and Kedara perform kirtan, sing Gurbani before the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਪਰਗਟੁ ਪਾਹਾਰਾ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Paragatu Paahaaraa ?18?
translation: The grandeur of the holy congregation is obvious.
Other sikhs of the fifth Guru

gurmukhi: ਗੰਗੂ ਨਾੳੂ ਸਹਗਲਾ ਰਾਮਾ ਧਰਮਾ ੳੁਦਾ ਭਾੲੀ
transliteration: Gangoo Naaoo Sahagalaa Raamaa Dharamaa Udaa Bhaaee.
translation: Gangu is a barber and Rama, Dharma, Uda are Sahgal brothers.

gurmukhi: ਜਟੂ ਭਟੂ ਵੇਤਿਅਾ ਫਿਰਣਾ ਸੂਦੁ ਵਡਾ ਸਤ ਭਾੲੀ
transliteration: Jatoo Bhatoo Vantiaa Dhiranaa Soodu Vadaa Sat Bhaaee.
translation: Bhai Jattu, Bhattu, Banta, and Phirana are Sud brothers and love each other very much.

gurmukhi: ਭੋਲੂ ਭਟੂ ਜਾਣੀਅਨਿ ਸਨਮੁਖ ਤੇਵਾੜੀ ਸੁਖਦਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bholoo Bhatoo Jaaneeani Sanamoukh Tayvaarhee Soukhadaaee.
translation: Bholu, Bhattu and Tivari give happiness to others and are known as the Sikhs of the court of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਡਲਾ ਭਾਗੀ ਭਗਤੁ ਹੈ ਜਾਪੂ ਨਿਵਲਾ ਗੁਰ ਸਰਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Dalaa Bhaagee Bhagatu Hai Jaapoo Nivalaa Gur Saranaaee.
translation: Dalla , Bhagi , Japu and Nivala have come to the shelter of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਮੂਲਾ ਸੂਜਾ ਧਾਵਣੇ ਚੰਦੂ ਚੳੁਝੜ ਸੇਵ ਕਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Moolaa Soojaa Dhaavanay Chandoo Chaujharh Sayv Kamaaee.
translation: Mula, Suja of Dhavan caste and Chandu of Chaujhar caste have served (in the guru-court).

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮਦਾਸੁ ਭੰਡਾਰੀਅਾ ਬਾਲਾ ਸਾੲੀਂਦਾਸੁ ਧਿਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Raamadaasu Bhandaareeaa Baalaa Saaeendaasu Dhiaaee.
translation: Mula, Suja of Dhavan caste and Chandu of Chaujhar caste have served (in the guru-court).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਬਿਸਨੂ ਬੀਬੜਾ ਮਾਛੀ ਸੁੰਦਰਿ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Bisanu Beebarhaa Maachhee Soundari Guramati Paaee.
translation: The fishermen Bisanu, Bibara and Sundar presenting themselves to the Guru have adopted the teachings of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਡੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ||੧੯||
transliteration: Saadh Sangati Vadee Vadiaaee ?19?
translation: Great is the grandeur of the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਸਿੱਖ ਨਾਮਾਵਲੀ
translation: Inventory of Sikhs

gurmukhi: ਜਟੂ ਭਾਨੂ ਤੀਰਥਾ ਚਾੲਿ ਚੲੀਲੇ ਚਢੇ ਚਾਰੇ
transliteration: Jatoo Bhaanoo Teeradaa Chaai Chaeelay Chaddhay Chaaray.
translation: Along with Nihala, Jattu, Bhanu and Tiratha of Chaddha caste love the Guru very dearly.

gurmukhi: ਸਣੇ ਨਿਹਾਲੇ ਜਾਣੀਅਨਿ ਸਨਮੁਖ ਸੇਵਕ ਗੁਰੂ ਪਿਅਾਰੇ
transliteration: Sanay Nihaalay Jaaneeani Sanamoukh Sayvak Guroo Piaaray.
translation: They are close servants who always remain before the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸੇਖੜ ਸਾਧ ਵਖਾਣੀਅਹਿ ਨਾੳੂ ਭੁਲੂ ਸਿਖ ਸੁਚਾਰੇ
transliteration: Saykharh Saadh Vakhaaneeahi Naau Bhuloo Sikh Souchaaray.
translation: Nau and Bhallu are known as Sadhus of Sekhar caste and are Sikhs of good conduct.

gurmukhi: ਜਟੂ ਭੀਵਾ ਜਾਣੀਅਨਿ ਮਹਾਂ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਮੂਲਾ ਪਰਵਾਰੇ
transliteration: Jatoo Bheevaa Jaaneeani Mahaan Purakhu Moolaa Paravaaray.
translation: Jattu of Bhiva caste and the greatman Mula along with his family are the Sikhs of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਚਤੁਰਦਾਸੁ ਮੂਲਾ ਕਪੂਰੁ ਹਾੜੂ ਗਾੜੂ ਵਿਜ ਵਿਚਾਰੇ
transliteration: Chaturadaasu Moolaa Kapooru Haarhoo Gaarhoo Vij Vichaaray.
translation: Chatur Das and Mula are kalpur Kshatryias and Haru and Garu belong to Vij caste.

gurmukhi: ਫਿਰਣਾ ਬਹਿਲੁ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਜੇਠਾ ਚੰਗਾ ਕੁਲ ਨਿਸਤਾਰੇ
transliteration: Dhiranaa Bahilu Vakhaaneeai Jaytdaa Changaa Kulu Nisataaray.
translation: A Sikh named Phirana is of Bahal subcaste and Bhai Jetha is a pretty good liberator of the family.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਸਾ ਗੋਪੀ ਤੁਲਸੀਅਾ ਭਾਰਦੁਅਾਜੀ ਸਨਮੁਖ ਸਾਰੇ
transliteration: Visaa Gopee Tulaseeaa Bhaaraduaajee Sanamoukh Saaray.
translation: Vissa, Gopi, Tulasis et al. all belong to Bhardvaj (brahmin) family and always remain with the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਵਡਾ ਭਗਤੁ ਹੈ ਭਾੲੀਅੜਾ ਗੋੲਿੰਦੁ ਘੇੲੀ ਗੁਰੂ ਦੁਅਾਰੇ
transliteration: Vadaa Bhagatu Hai Bhaaeearhaa Goindu Ghayee Guroo Duaaray.
translation: Bhaiara and Govind are devotees belonging to Ghai Caste. They remain at the door of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰਿ ਪੂਰੇ ਪਾਰਿ ੳੁਤਾਰੇ ||੨੦||
transliteration: Satiguri Pooray Paari Outaaray ?20?
translation: The perfect Guru has fetched across the world ocean.

gurmukhi: ੨੧ ਸੁਲਤਾਨ ਪੁਰੀੲੇ ਸਿਖ
translation: Sikhs from Sultanpur

gurmukhi: ਕਾਲੂ ਚਾੳੂ ਬੰਮੀਅਾ ਮੂਲੇ ਨੋ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦੁ ਪਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Kaaloo Chaaoo Banmeeaa Moolay No Gur Sabadu Piaaraa.
translation: Bhai Kalu, Chau, Bammi and Bhai Mula love the Word of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਹੇਮਾ ਵਿਚਿ ਕਪਾਹੀਅਾ ਗੋੲਿੰਦੁ ਘੇੲੀ ਗੁਰ ਨਿਸਤਾਰਾ
transliteration: Homaa Vichi Kapaaheeaa Gobindu Ghayee Gur Nisataaraa.
translation: Along with Homa, the cotton trader, Goving Ghai was also taken across by the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਭਿਖਾ ਟੋਡਾ ਭਟ ਦੁੲਿ ਧਾਰੂ ਸੂਦ ਮਹਲ ਤਿਸੁ ਭਾਰਾ
transliteration: Bhikhaa Todaa Bhat Dui Dhaaroo Sood Mahalu Tisu Bhaaraa.
translation: Bhikkha and Todi both were Bhatts and Dharu Sud had a large mansion.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਰਾਮੂ ਕੋਹਲੀ ਨਾਲਿ ਨਿਹਾਲੂ ਸੇਵਕੁ ਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Raamoo Kohalee Naali Nihaaloo Sayvaku Saaraa.
translation: Gurmukh of Kohli caste and Ramu along with servant Nihalu are also there.

gurmukhi: ਛਜੂ ਭਲਾ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਮਾੲੀ ਦਿਤਾ ਸਾਧੁ ਵਿਚਾਰਾ
transliteration: Chhajoo Bhalaa Jaaneeai Maaee Ditaa Saadhu Vichaaraa.
translation: Chhaju was Bhalla and Mai Ditta was a poor sadhu.

gurmukhi: ਤੁਲਸਾ ਵਹੁਰਾ ਭਗਤੁ ਹੈ ਦਾਮੋਦਰੁ ਅਾਕੁਲ ਬਲਿਹਾਰਾ
transliteration: Tulasaa Vahuraa Bhagat Hai Daamodaru Aakul Balihaaraa.
translation: Devotte Tulasa is of Bohara caste and I am sacrifice unto Damodar and Akul.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਨਾ ਅਾਵਲ ਵਿਗਹਮਲੁ ਬੁਧੂ ਛੀਂਬਾ ਗੁਰ ਦਰਬਾਰਾ
transliteration: Bhaanaa Aaval Vigahamalu Budho Chheenbaa Gur Darabaaraa.
translation: Bhana, Vigah Mal and Buddho, the calicoprinter have also come to the court of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਲਤਾਨ ਪੁਰਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਭੰਡਾਰਾ ||੨੧||
transliteration: Sulataanay Puri Bhagati Bhandaaraa ?21?
translation: Sultanpur is the warehouse of devotion (and devotees).

gurmukhi: ੨੨ ਮਸੰਦ ਸਿੱਖ
translation: Masands or the tithe collector Sikhs

gurmukhi: ਦੀਪਕੁ ਦੀਪਾ ਕਾਸਰਾ ਗੁਰੂ ਦੁਅਾਰੈ ਹੁਕਮੀ ਬੰਦਾ
transliteration: Deepaku Deepaa Kaasaraa Guroo Duaarai Houkamee Bandaa.
translation: An obedient Sikh named Dipa of Kasara caste was a lamp at the door of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਪਟੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਚੳੁਧਰੀ ਢਿਲੋਂ ਲਾਲੁ ਲੰਗਾਹੁ ਸੁਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Patee Andari Chaudharee Ddhilo Laalu Lagaahu Suhandaa.
translation: In the town of Patti, Bhai lal and Bhai Langah of Dhillon caste are well seated.

gurmukhi: ਅਜਬੁ ਅਜਾੲਿਬੁ ਸੰਙਿਅਾ ੳੁਮਰਸਾਹੁ ਗੁਰ ਸੇਵ ਕਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Ajabu Ajaaibu Sanaai Oumarasaahu Gur Sayv Karandaa.
translation: Ajab, Ajaib and Umar belonging to Sangha caste are the servants (masands) of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਪੈੜਾ ਛਜਲੁ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਕੰਦੂ ਸੰਘਰੁ ਮਿਲੈ ਹਸੰਦਾ
transliteration: Pairhaa Chhajalu Jaaneeai Kandoo Sangharu Milai Hasandaa.
translation: Paira is of Chhajal caste and Kandu belongs to Sanghar caste. They greet everybody with a warming smile.

gurmukhi: ਪੁਤੁ ਸਪੁਤ ਕਪੂਰਿ ਦੇੳੁ ਸਿਖੈ ਮਿਲਿਅਾ ਮਨਿ ਵਿਗਸੰਦਾ
transliteration: Poutu Sapoutu Kapoori Dayu Sikhai Miliaan Mani Vigasandaa.
translation: Kapur Dev along with his son gets blossomed when he meets the Sikhs.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਮਣੁ ਹੈ ਸਾਹਬਾਜ ਪੁਰਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖਾਂ ਦੀ ਸਾਰ ਲਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Sanmanu Hai Saahabaaj Puri Gurasikhaan Dee Saar Lahandaa.
translation: In Shahbazpur, Saman takes care of the Sikhs.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਧਾ ਜਲੋ ਤੁਲਸ ਪੁਰਿ ਮੋਹਣ ਅਾਲਮੁ ਗੰਜਿ ਰਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Jodhaa Jalo Tulas Puri Mohan Aalamu Ganji Rahandaa.
translation: Jodha and Jalan in Tulaspur and Mohan lives in Alam Ganj.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਵਡਿਅਾ ਵਡੇ ਮਸੰਦਾ ||੨੨||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Vadiaa Vaday Masandaa ?22?
translation: These big masands surpass one another.

gurmukhi: ੨੩ ਅਤਿ ਸਨਮੁਖ ਸਿੱਖ
translation: Very close Sikhs

gurmukhi: ਢੇਸੀ ਜੋਧੁ ਹੁਸੰਗੁ ਹੈ ਗੋੲਿੰਦੁ ਗੋਲਾ ਹਸਿ ਮਿਲੰਦਾ
transliteration: Ddhaysee Jodhuhu Sangu Hai Goindu Golaa Hasi Miladaa.
translation: Bhai Dhesi amd Bhai Jodha and Husang brahmins and Bhai Gobind and Gola meet with smiling faces.

gurmukhi: ਮੋਹਣੁ ਕੁਕੁ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਧੁਟੇ ਜੋਧੇ ਜਾਮੁ ਸੁਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Mohanu Kouku Vakhaaneeai Dhoutay Jodhay Jaamu Suhandaa.
translation: Mohan is said to be of Kuk caste and Jodha and Jama adorn Dhutta village.

gurmukhi: ਮੰਞਞਞਞੁ ਪੰਨੂ ਪਰਵਾਣੁ ਹੈ ਪੀਰਾਣਾ ਗੁਰ ਭਾੲਿ ਚਲੰਦਾ
transliteration: Manjhu Pannoo Paravaanu Hai Peeraanaa Gur Bhaai Chaladaa.
translation: Manjh, the blest one and pirana et al. conduct in the will of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਹਮਜਾ ਜਜਾ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਬਾਲਾ ਮਰਵਾਹਾ ਵਿਗਸੰਦਾ
transliteration: Hamajaa Jajaa Jaaneeai Baalaa Maravaahaa Vigasandaa.
translation: Bhai Hamaja, said to be Jaja, and Bala, the Marvaha behave delightfully.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਰਮਲੁ ਨਾਨੋ ਓਹਰੀ ਨਾਲਿ ਸੂਰੀ ਚੳੁਧਰੀ ਰਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Niramal Naano Aoharee Naali Sooree Chaudharee Rahandaa.
translation: Nano Ohari is of pure mind and along with him remains Suri, the Chaudhary.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਬਤਿ ਕਾਲਾ ਮੇਹਰਾ ਨਾਲਿ ਨਿਹਾਲੂ ਸੇਵ ਕਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Parabati Kaalaa Mayharaa Naali Nihaaloo Sayv Karandaa.
translation: Inhabitants of mountains are Bhai kala and Mehara and with them Bhai Nihalu also serves.

gurmukhi: ਕਕਾ ਕਾਲੳੁ ਸੂਰਮਾ ਕਦੁ ਰਾਮਦਾਸ ਬਚਨ ਮਨੰਦਾ
transliteration: Kakaa Kaalau Sooramaa Kadu Raamadaasu Bachan Mannadaa.
translation: Brown coloured Kalu is brave and Ram Das belonging to kad caste is obeyer of the words of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸੇਠ ਸਭਾਗਾ ਚੁਹਣੀਅਹੁ ਅਾਰੋੜੇ ਭਾਗ ੳੁਗਵੰਦਾ
transliteration: Saytd Sabhaagaa Chuhaneeahu Aarorhay Bhaag Ougavandaa.
translation: Rich person Subhaga resides in Chuhania town and with him are Bhag Mal and Ugvanda, the Arora Sikhs.

gurmukhi: ਸਨਮੁਖ ੲਿਕਦੂ ੲਿਕ ਚੜ੍ਹੰਦਾ ||੨੩||
transliteration: Sanamoukh Ikadoo Ik Charhanhadaa ?23?
translation: All these are devotees surpassing one another.

gurmukhi: ੨੪ ਪੰਜਾਬ ਦੇ ਹੀ ਸਿੱਖ
translation: Sikhs of Panjab only

gurmukhi: ਪੈੜਾ ਜਾਤਿ ਚੰਡਾਲੀਅਾ ਜੇਠੇ ਸੇਠੀ ਕਾਰ ਕਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Pairhaa Jaati Chandaaleeaa Jaytday Saytdee Kaam Kamaaee.
translation: Paira of Chandali caste and Jetha of Sethi caste and such Sikhs who do manual labour.

gurmukhi: ਲਟਕਣੁ ਘੂਰਾ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਗੁਰਦਿਤਾ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਗੁਰਭਾੲੀ
transliteration: Latakanu Ghooraa Jaaneeai Guraditaa Guramati Gurabhaaee.
translation: Bhai Latakan, Ghura, Gurditta are fellow disciples of the Gurmat.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਟਾਰਾੳੁ ਸਰਾਫ ਹੈ ਭਗਤ ਵਡਾ ਭਗਵਾਨ ਸੁਭਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kataaraa Saraadh Hai Bhagatu Vadaa Bhagavaan Soubhaaee.
translation: Bhai Katara is a gold merchant and Bhai Bhagavan Das is of devotional nature.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਖ ਭਲਾ ਰਵਿਤਾਸ ਵਿਚਿ ਧੳੁਣ ਮੁਰਾਰੀ ਗੁਰ ਸਰਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sikh Bhalaa Ravitaas Vichi Dhaounu Muraaree Gur Saranaaee.
translation: Inhabitant of Rohtas village and belonging to Dhavan caste, a Sikh named Murari has come in the shelter of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਡਿਤ ਸੁੲਿਨੀ ਸੂਰਮਾ ਚਰਣ ਸਰਣਿ ਚੂਹੜੁ ਜੇ ਸਾੲੀ
transliteration: Aadit Suinee Sooramaa Charan Sarani Chooharhu Jay Saaee.
translation: Adit, the brave belonging to Soni caste and Chuhar and Sain Das also have sought the shelter of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਲਾਲਾ ਸੇਠੀ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਜਾਣੁ ਨਿਹਾਲੂ ਸਬਦਿ ਲਿਵਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Laal Saytdee Jaaneeai Jaanu Nihaaloo Sabadi Liv Laaee.
translation: Along with Nihal, Lala (Lalu) also knows how to merge consciousness in Word.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮਾ ਝੰਝੀ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਹੇਮੂ ਸੋੲੀ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Raamaa Jhanjhee Aakheeai Haymoo Soee Guramati Paaee.
translation: Rama is said to be of Jhanjhi caste. Hemu also has adopted the wisdom of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਜਟੂ ਭੰਡਾਰੀ ਭਲਾ ਸਾਹਦਰੈ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਸੁਖਦਾੲੀ
transliteration: Jatoo Bhandaaree Bhalaa Saahadarai Sangati Soukhadaaee.
translation: Jattu Bhandari is a good Sikh and this whole congregation lives in Shahadara (Lahore) happily.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਜਾਬੈ ਗੁਰ ਦੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ||੨੪||
transliteration: Panjaabai Gur Dee Vadiaaee ?24?
translation: Greatness of the house of the Guru resides in Punjab.

gurmukhi: ੨੫ ਲਾਹੌਰ ਮੁਜੰਗੀ ਸੰਗਤ
translation: The congregation of Lahore-Mujang

gurmukhi: ਸਨਮੁਖਿ ਸਿਖ ਲਾਹੌਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਸੋਢੀ ਅਾੲਿਣੁ ਤਾੲਿਅਾ ਸੰਹਾਰੀ
transliteration: Sanamoukhi Sikh Laahaur Vichi Soddhee Aainu Taaiaa Sanhaaree.
translation: In Lahore from the family of Sodhis the elderly uncle Sahari Mal is the close Sikh of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਾੲੀਂ ਦਿਤਾ ਝੰਝੀਅਾ ਸੈਦੋ ਜਟੁ ਸਬਦੁ ਵੀਚਾਰੀ
transliteration: Saaeen Ditaa Jhanjheeaa Saido Jatu Sabadu Veechaaree.
translation: Sain Ditta of Jhanjhi caste and Saido, the Jatt, are thinkers of the Word of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਬੁਧੂ ਮਹਿਤਾ ਜਾਣੀਅਹਿ ਕੁਲ ਕੁਮ੍ਹਿਅਾਰ ਭਗਤਿ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰੀ
transliteration: Saadhoo Mahitaa Jaaneeahi Kul Koumhiaar Bhagati Nirankaaree.
translation: From the family of potters Sadhu Mehta is known to be the devotees of the formless.

gurmukhi: ਲਖੂ ਵਿਚਿ ਪਟੋਲੀਅਾ ਭਾੲੀ ਲਧਾ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ
transliteration: Lakhoo Vichi Patoleeaa Bhaaee Ladhaa Paraoupoukaaree.
translation: From among the Patolis, Bhai Lakhu and Bhai Ladha are the altruists.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਲੂ ਨਾਨੋ ਰਾਜ ਦੁੲਿ ਹਾੜੀ ਕੋਹਲੀਅਾ ਵਿਚਿ ਭਾਰੀ
transliteration: Kaaloo Naano Raaj Dui Haarhee Kohaleeaa Vichi Bhaaree.
translation: Bhai kalu and Bhai Nano, both masons, and from among the Kohlis, Bhai Hari is a grand Sikh.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਦੁ ਕਲਿਅਾਣਾ ਸੂਰਮਾ ਭਾਨੂ ਭਗਤੁ ਸਬਦੁ ਵੀਚਾਰੀ
transliteration: Soodu Kaliaanaa Sooramaa Bhaanoo Bhagatu Sabadu Veechaaree.
translation: Kalyana Sud is the brave one and Bhanu, the devotee is a thinker of the Guru’s Word.

gurmukhi: ਮੂਲਾ ਬੇਰੀ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਤੀਰਥੁ ਅਤੈ ਮੁਕੰਦੁ ਅਪਾਰੀ
transliteration: Moolaa Bayree Jaaneeai Teeradu Atai Moukandu Apaaree.
translation: Kalyana Sud is the brave one and Bhanu, the devotee is a thinker of the Guru’s Word.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੁ ਕਿਸਨਾ ਮੁਹਜੰਗੀਅਾ ਸੇਠ ਮੰਗੀਣੇ ਨੋ ਬਲਿਹਾਰੀ
transliteration: Kahu Kisanaa Muhanjageeaa Saytd Mangeenay No Balihaaree.
translation: A devotee from Mujang is known by the name of Kisana and I am sacrifice unto Mangina, the wealthy person.

gurmukhi: ਸਨਮੁਖ ਸੁਨਿਅਾਰਾ ਭਲਾ ਨਾੳੁ ਨਿਹਾਲੂ ਸਪਰਵਾਰੀ
transliteration: Sanamoukhu Souniaaraa Bhalaa Naau Nihaaloo Saparavaaree.
translation: A goldsmith named Nihalu along with his family remains present before the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਕਰਣੀ ਸਾਰੀ ||੨੫||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Karanee Saaree ?25?
translation: These all have performed delight giving perfect devotion bestowed by the Guru.

gurmukhi: ੨੬ ਦੇਸ਼ਾਂਤਰੀ ਸੰਗਤ
translation: The Sikhs from country and abroad

gurmukhi: ਭਾਨਾ ਮਲਣੁ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਕਾਬਲਿ ਰੇਖਰਾੳੁ ਗੁਰਭਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bhaanaa Malanu Jaaneeai Kaabali Raykh Raau Gurabhaaee.
translation: Bhana Malhan and Rekh Rao, the fellow disciples of the Guru are known to be residing in Kabul.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਧੋ ਸੋਢੀ ਕਾਸਮੀਰ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੀ ਦੀ ਚਾਲ ਚਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Maadho Soddhee Kaasameer Gur Sikhee Dee Chaal Chalaaee.
translation: Madho Sodhi made the Sikh tradition in vogue in Kashmir.

gurmukhi: ਭਾੲੀ ਭੀਵਾ ਸੀਹਰੰਦਿ ਰੂਪਚੰਦੁ ਸਨਮੁਖ ਸਤ ਭਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bhaaee Bheevaan Seeharandi Roopachandu Sanamoukh Sat Bhaaee.
translation: The truly devoted and close Sikhs are Bhai Bhiva, Sih Chand and Rup Chand (of Sirhind).

gurmukhi: ਪਰਤਾਪੂ ਸਿਖੁ ਸੂਰਮਾ ਨੰਦੈ ਵਿਠੜਿ ਸੇਵ ਕਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Parataapoo Sikhu Sooramaa Nadai Vitdarhi Sayv Kamaaee.
translation: Bhai Partapu is a brave Sikhs and Vithar caste Bhai Nanda has also served the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਮੀਦਾਸ ਵਛੇਰੁ ਹੈ ਥਾਨੇਸੁਰ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਬਹਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Saameedaas Vachhayru Hai Daanaysuri Sangati Bahalaaee.
translation: Bhai Sami Das of Bachher caste inspired the congregation of Thanesar towards the house of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਗੋਪੀ ਮਹਤਾ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਤੀਰਥੁ ਨਥਾ ਗੁਰ ਸਰਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Gopee Mahataa Jaaneeai Teeradu Nadaa Gur Saranaaee.
translation: Gopi, a Mehta Sikh is a well known and Tirath and Natha have also come in the shelter of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਭਾੳੂ ਮੋਕਲੁ ਅਾਖੀਅਹਿ ਢਿਲੀ ਮੰਡਲਿ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bhaaoo Mokalu Aakheeahi Ddhilee Mandali Guramati Paaee.
translation: Bhai Bhau, Mokal, Bhai Dhilli and Bhai Mandal are also said to have been bapitised in the Gurmat.

gurmukhi: ਜੀਵੰਦ ਜਗਸੀ ਫਤੇਪੁਰਿ ਸੇਠਿ ਤਲੋਕੇ ਸੇਵ ਕਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Jeevadu Jagasee Dhatay Puri Saytdi Talokay Sayv Kamaaee.
translation: Bhai Jivanda, Bhai Jagasi and Tiloka have served well at fatehpur.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਦੀ ਵਡੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ||੨੬||
transliteration: Satigur Dee Vadee Vadiaaee ?26?
translation: Great is the grandeur of the true Guru.

gurmukhi: ੨੭ ਅਾਗਰੇ ਦੀ ਸੰਗਤ
translation: Agra congregation

gurmukhi: ਮਹਤਾ ਸਕਤੁ ਅਾਗਰੈ ਚਢਾ ਹੋਅਾ ਨਿਹਾਲੁ ਨਿਹਾਲਾ
transliteration: Mahataa Sakatu Aagarai Chaddhaa Hoaa Nihaalu Nihaalaa.
translation: Saktu Mehta and Nihalu Chaddha of Agra have become blest.

gurmukhi: ਗੜ੍ਹੀਅਲੁ ਮਥਰਾ ਦਾਸੁ ਹੈ ਸਪਰਵਾਰਾ ਲਾਲ ਗੁਲਾਲਾ
transliteration: Garhheealu Madaraa Daasu Hai Saparavaaraa Laal Gulaalaa.
translation: Bhai Garhial and Mathara Das and their families are said to have been dyed in the red colour of love for the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਗੰਗਾ ਸਹਗਲੁ ਸੂਰਮਾ ਹਰਵੰਸ ਤਪੇ ਟਹਲ ਧ੍ਰਮਸਾਲਾ
transliteration: Gangaa Sahagalu Sooramaa Haravans Tapay Tahal Dharamasaalaa.
translation: Ganga belonging to Sahagal caste is brave and Harbans, the hermit serves in the dharamsala, the inn for the pilgrims.

gurmukhi: ਅਣਦੁ ਮੁਰਾਰੀ ਮਹਾਂਪੁਰਖੁ ਕਲਿਅਾਣਾ ਕੁਲਿ ਕਵਲੁ ਰਸਾਲਾ
transliteration: Anadu Muraaree Mahaanpurakhu Kaliaanaa Kuli Kavalu Rasaalaa.
translation: Murari of Anand caste is a saint of high order and Kalyana is the house of love and pure like lotus.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਨੋ ਲਟਕਣੁ ਬਿੰਦਰਾੳੁ ਸੇਵਾ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਪੂਰਣ ਘਾਲਾ
transliteration: Naano Latakanu Bindaraau Sayvaa Sangati Pooran Ghaalaa.
translation: Bhai Nano, Bhai Latakan and Bind Rao have served the congregation with full labour and love.

gurmukhi: ਹਾਂਡਾ ਅਾਲਮਚੰਦੁ ਹੈ ਸੈਂਸਾਰਾ ਤਲਵਾੜੁ ਸੁਖਾਲਾ
transliteration: Handaa Aalamachandu Hai Saisaaraa Talavaarhu Soukhaalaa.
translation: Alam Chand Handa, Sainsara Talvar are the Sikhs who live with all happiness.

gurmukhi: ਜਗਨਾ ਨੰਦਾ ਸਾਧ ਹੈ ਭਾਨੂ ਸੁਹੜੁ ਹੰਸਾਂ ਦੀ ਢਾਲਾ
transliteration: Jaganaa Nadaa Saadh Hai Bhaanoo Suharhu Hansaan Dee Ddhaalaa.
translation: Jagana and Nanda both are sadhus and Bhana of Suhar caste is competent like swan to have discerned from the real from false.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਭਾੲੀ ਰਤਨਾਂ ਦੀ ਮਾਲਾ ||੨੭||
transliteration: Gurabhaaee Ratanaan Dee Maalaa ?27?
translation: These, all fellow disciples of the Guru, are like the jewels of a string.

gurmukhi: ੨੮ ਹਜ਼ੂਰੀ ਸਿੱਖ
translation: The ever present Sikhs

gurmukhi: ਸੀਗਾਰੂ ਜੈਤਾ ਭਲਾ ਸੂਰਬੀਰ ਮਨਿ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Seegaaroo Jaitaa Bhalaa Soorabeer Mani Paraoupakaaraa.
translation: Sigaru and Jaita are nice brave and of the altruistic bent of mind.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਤਾ ਨੰਦਾ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਪੁਰਖ ਪਿਰਾਗਾ ਸਬਦਿ ਅਧਾਰਾ
transliteration: Jaitaa Nadaa Jaaneeai Purakh Piraagaa Sabadi Adhaaraa.
translation: Bhai Jaita, Nanda and Piraga have accepted Word as the basis of all.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਲਕੁ ਤਿਲੋਕਾ ਪਾਠਕਾ ਸਾਧੁ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਸੇਵਾ ਹਿਤਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Tilaku Tilokaa Paatdakaa Saadhu Sangati Sayvaa Hitakaaraa.
translation: Tiloka Pathak is the glorious mark that considers holy congregation and its service as the benevolent.

gurmukhi: ਤੋਤਾ ਮਹਤਾ ਮਹਾਂਪੁਰਖੁ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਸਬਦੁ ਪਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Totaa Mahataa Mahaanpurakhu Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Sabadu Piaaraa.
translation: Tota Mehata is a great man and like Gurmukhs loves the delightful fruit of the Word.

gurmukhi: ਜੜੀਅਾ ਸਾੲੀਂਦਾਸੁ ਹੈ ਸਭ ਕੁਲੁ ਹੀਰੇ ਲਾਲ ਅਪਾਰਾ
transliteration: Jarheeaa Saaeendaasu Hai Sabh Kulu Heeray Laal Apaaraa.
translation: The whole of the family of Bhai Sain Das is like invaluable diamonds and jewels.

gurmukhi: ਮਲਕ ਪੈੜਾ ਹੈ ਕੋਹਲੀ ਦਰਗਹੁ ਭੰਡਾਰੀ ਅਤਿ ਭਾਰਾ
transliteration: Malaku Pairhaa Hai Kohalee Daragahu Bhandaaree Ati Bhaaraa.
translation: Noble Paira, the Kohali is the store keeper of the court of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਮੀਅਾਂ ਜਮਾਲੁ ਨਿਹਾਲੁ ਹੈ ਭਗਤੂ ਭਗਤ ਕਮਾਵੈ ਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Meeaan Jamaalu Nihaalu Hai Bhagatoo Bhagat Kamaavai Kaaraa.
translation: Mian Jamal has become glad and Bhagatu is busy in devotion.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਾ ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰਾ ਵਰਤਾਰਾ ||੨੮||
transliteration: Pooraa Gur Pooraa Varataaraa ?28?
translation: The behaviour of the perfect Guru with the Sikhs is the perfect one.

gurmukhi: ੨੯ ਛਟਮ ਗੁਰੂ ਜੀ ਦੇ ਸਿੱਖਾਂ ਦੇ ਨਾਮ
translation: Names of the Sikhs of the sixth Guru

gurmukhi: ਅਾਨੰਤਾ ਕੁਕੋ ਭਲੇ ਸੋਭ ਵਧਾਵਣ ਹਨਿ ਸਿਰਦਾਰਾ
transliteration: Aanataa Kookay Bhalay Sobh Vadhaavan Hani Siradaaraa.
translation: Ananta and Kuko are good persons who adorn the occasions.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਟਾ ਰੋੜਾ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਨਵਲ ਨਿਹਾਲੂ ਸਬਦ ਵੀਚਾਰਾ
transliteration: Itaa Rorhaa Jaaneeai Naval Nihaaloo Sabad Veechaaraa.
translation: Ita Arora, Naval and Nihalu ponder upon the Word.

gurmukhi: ਤਖਤੂ ਧੀਰ ਗੰਭੀਰ ਹੈ ਦਰਗਹੁ ਤੁਲੀ ਜਪੈ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Takhatoo Dheer Ganbheeru Hai Daragahu Tulee Japai Nirankaaraa.
translation: Takhatu is serious and serne and Daragahu Tuli is always absorbed in remembering the formless Lord.

gurmukhi: ਮਨਸਾ ਧਾਰੁ ਅਥਾਹੁ ਹੈ ਤੀਰਥੁ ੳੁਪਲੁ ਸੇਵਕ ਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Manousaa Dhaaru Adaahu Hai Teeradu Oupalu Sayvak Saaraa.
translation: Manasadhar is deep and Tirath Uppal is also servant.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਸਨਾ ਝੰਝੀ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਪੰਮੂ ਪੁਰੀ ਗੁਰੂ ਕਾ ਪਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Kisanaa Jhanjhee Aakheeai Panmoo Puree Guroo Kaa Piaaraa.
translation: Kisana Jhanji and Pammi Puri are also dear to the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਧਿੰਗੜੁ ਮੱਦੂ ਜਾਣੀਅਨਿ ਵਡੇ ਸੁਜਾਨ ਤਖਾਣ ਅਪਾਰਾ
transliteration: Dhingarhu Madoo Jaaneeani Vaday Sujaan Takhaan Apaaraa.
translation: Dhingar and Maddu artisans are carpenters and are very noble persons.

gurmukhi: ਬਨਵਾਲੀ ਤੇ ਪਰਸਰਾਮ ਬਾਲ ਵੈਦ ਹੳੁ ਤਿਨਿ ਬਲਿਹਾਰਾ
transliteration: Banavaalee Tay Parasaraam Baal Vaid Hau Tini Balihaaraa.
translation: I am sacrifice unto Banavari and Paras Ram who are experts in paediatrics.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਸਵਾਰਨ ਹਾਰਾ ||੨੯||
transliteration: Satigur Purakhu Savaaranahaaraa ?29?
translation: The supreme Lord sets right the wrongs done to the devotees.

gurmukhi: ੩੦ ਛਟਮ ਗੁਰ ਦੇ ਸਿੱਖ
translation: Other Sikhs of the sixth Guru

gurmukhi: ਲਸਕਰ ਭਾੲੀ ਤੀਰਥਾ ਗੁਅਾਲੀੲੇਰ ਸੁੲਿਨੀ ਹਰਿਦਾਸੁ
transliteration: Lasakari Bhaaee Teeradaa Guaaleeayr Suinee Haridaasu.
translation: Bhai Tiratha is from Laskar and Hari Das Soni belongs to Gwalior.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਵਾ ਧੀਰੁ ੳੁਜੈਨ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਬਦਿ ਨਿਵਾਸ
transliteration: Bhaavaa Dheeru Ujain Vichi Saadhasangati Guru Sabadi Nivaasu.
translation: Bhava Dhir comes from Ujjain and resides in Word and the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਮੇਲ ਵਡਾ ਬੁਰਹਾਨਪੁਰਿ ਸਨਮੁਖ ਸਿਖ ਸਹਜ ਪਰਗਾਸ
transliteration: Maylu Vadaa Burahaan Puri Sanamoukh Sikh Sahaj Paragaasu.
translation: Famous are the Sikhs of Burhan Pur who love one another and reside in the equipoise.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤ ਭੲੀਅਾ ਭਗਵਾਨ ਦਾਸ ਨਾਲਿ ਬੋਦਲਾ ਘਰੇ ੳੁਦਾਸ
transliteration: Bhagatu Bhaeeaa Bhagavaan Daas Naali Bodalaa Gharay Udaasu.
translation: Bhagat Bhaia Bhagvan Das is the devotee and with him is a Sikh named Bodala who lives in his home becoming fully detached.

gurmukhi: ਮਲਕ ਕਟਾਰੂ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਪਿਰਥੀ ਮੱਲ ਜਰਾਹੀ ਖਾਸ
transliteration: Malaku Kataaroo Jaaneeai Piradeemal Jaraadee Khaasu.
translation: Kataru, the noble one and physician Piathimal are especially well known personalities.

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤੂ ਛੁਰਾ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਡੱਲੂ ਰੀਹਾਣੈ ਸਾਬਾਸ
transliteration: Bhagatoo Chhuraa Vakhaaneeai Daloo Reehaanai Saabaasu.
translation: Devotee Chhura and Dallu are said to be the inhabitants of Haryana.

gurmukhi: ਸੁੰਦਰ ਸੁਅਾਮੀ ਦਾਸ ਦੁੲਿ ਵੰਸ ਵਧਾਵਣ ਕਵਲ ਵਿਗਾਸ
transliteration: Soundar Suaamee Daas Dui Vans Vadhaavan Kaval Vigaasu.
translation: Sundar and Swami Das both are developers of the tradition of Sikhism and live always like a blossomed lotus.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਜਰਾਤੇ ਵਿਚਿ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਭੇਖਾਰੀ ਭਾਬੜਾ ਸੁਲਾਸ
transliteration: Gujaraatay Vichi Jaaneeai Bhaykhaaree Bhaabarhaa Sulaasu.
translation: Bhikhari, Bhavara and Sulas are Gujarati Sikhs.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਰਹਿਰਾਸੁ ||੩੦||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Bhaau Bhagati Rahiraasu ?30?
translation: All these Sikhs consider loving devotion as their way of life.

gurmukhi: ੩੧ ਛਟਮ ਗੁਰ ਦੇ ਸਿਖ
translation: Sikhs of the sixth Guru

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹੰਡੈ ਮਾੲੀਅਾ ਲੰਬ ਹੈ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗਾਵੈ ਗੁਰਬਾਣੀ
transliteration: Suhanddhai Maaeeaa Lamu Hai Saadhasangati Gaavai Gurabaanee.
translation: In village Suhanda is Bhai maia of lamb caste who sings the holy hymns in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਚੂਹੜ ਚੳੁਝੜ ਲਖਨੳੂ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਅਨਦਿਨੁ ਨਾਮ ਵਖਾਣੀ
transliteration: Chooharh Chaujharhu Lakhanaoo Guramoukhi Anadinu Naam Vakhaanee.
translation: Chuhar of Chaujhar caste from Lucknow is gurmukh who remembers Lord day and night.

gurmukhi: ਸਨਮੁਖ ਸਿਖੁ ਪਿਰਾਗ ਵਿਚ ਭਾੲੀ ਭਾਨਾ ਵਿਰਤੀਹਾਣੀ
transliteration: Sanamoukhi Sikhu Piraag Vich Bhaaee Bhaanaa Virateehaanee.
translation: Bhai Bhana of Prayag is a close Sikh who earns his livelihood.

gurmukhi: ਜਟੂ ਤਪਾ ਸੁ ਜੌਨਪੁਰਿ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਨਿਹਚਲ ਸੇਵ ਕਮਾਣੀ
transliteration: Jatoo Tapaa Su Jaoun Puri Guramati Nihachal Sayv Kamaanee.
translation: Jattu and Tappa, the residents of Jaunpur have served in accordance with Gurmat with stable mind.

gurmukhi: ਪਟਣੈ ਸਭਰਵਾਲ ਹੈ ਨਵਲੁ ਨਿਹਾਲਾ ਸੁਧ ਪਰਾਣੀ
transliteration: Patanai Sabharavaal Hai Navalu Nihaalaa Sudh Paraanee.
translation: In Patna Bhai naval and among Sabhaervals Nihala is a pious person.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਤਾ ਸੇਠ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਵਿਣੁ ਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਾ ਹੋਰੁ ਨ ਜਾਣੀ
transliteration: Jaitaa Saytd Vakhaaneeai Vinu Gur Sayvaa Horu N Jaanee.
translation: One wealthy person is known by the name of Jaita who likes nothing except the service of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜ ਮਹਿਲ ਭਾਨੂ ਬਹਿਲੁ ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਮਨਿ ਭਾਣੀ
transliteration: Raaj Mahil Bhaanoo Bahilu Bhaau Bhagati Guramati Mani Bhaanee.
translation: Of Rajmahal city is Bhanu Bahal whose mind is absorbed in the wisdom of the Guru and the loving devotion.

gurmukhi: ਸਨਮੁਖ ਸੋਢੀ ਬਦਲੀ ਸੇਠਿ ਗੁਪਾਲੈ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਜਾਣੀ
transliteration: Sanamoukhu Soddhee Badalee Saytd Goupaalai Guramati Jaanee.
translation: Badali Sodhi and Gopal, the rich persons understand the Gurmat.

gurmukhi: ਸੁੰਦਰੁ ਚਢਾ ਅਾਗਰੈ ਢਾਕੈ ਮੋਹਣਿ ਸੇਵ ਕਮਾਣੀ
transliteration: Soundaru Chaddhaa Aagarai Ddhaakai Mohani Sayv Kamaanee.
translation: Sundar Chaddha of Agra and Bhai Mohan a resident of Dhakka have served and cultivated the true earning.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਟਹੁ ਕੁਰਬਾਣੀ ||੩੧||੧੧||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Vitahu Kurabaanee ?31?11?
translation: I am sacrifice unto the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਸੰਧਿ ਮਿਲੇ ਬੀਸ ੲਿਕੀਸ ੲੀਸ ੲਿਤ ਤੇ ੳੁਲੰਘਿ ੳੁਤ ਜਾੲਿ ਠਹਰਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Gur Sikh Sandhi Milay Bees Ikees Eesa , It Tay Ulanghi Out Jaai Tthaharaavaee ?
translation: Meeting with Guru, a Sikh receives the Lord's word to meditate upon and by his untiring and resolute efforts become one with Him. He frees himself from the worldly matters and lives in harmony in the realm of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਮ ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਮੂਦ ਪੇਖੈ ਦਿਬ ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਕੈ ਜਗਮਗ ਜੋਤਿ ਓਨਮਨੀ ਸੁਧ ਪਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Charam Drisati Mood Paykhai Dib Drisati Kai , Jagamag Joti Ao?namanee Sudh Paavaee ?
translation: He shuts his eyes from mundane worldly attractions and lives in the spiritual wisdom that helps him feel His presence in everything.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਰਤਿ ਸੰਕੋਚਤ ਹੀ ਬਜਰ ਕਪਾਟ ਖੋਲਿ ਨਾਦ ਬਾਦ ਪਰੈ ਅਨਹਤ ਲਿਵ ਲਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Surati Sankochat Hee Bajar Kapaat Kholi , Naad Baad Parai Anahat Liv Laavaee ?
translation: Weaning his thoughts away from the worldly attractions, his doors of ignorance are opened; he is distracted from all sources of worldly pleasures and he gets engrossed in listening to celestial songs and music.

gurmukhi: ਬਚਨ ਬਿਸਰਜਤ ਅਨ ਰਸ ਰਹਿਤ ਹੁੲਿ ਨਿਝਰ ਅਪਾਰ ਧਾਰ ਅਪਿੳੁ ਪੀਅਾਵੲੀ ||੧੧||
transliteration: Bachan Bisarajat An Ras Rahit Hui , Nijhar Apaar Dhaar Apiu Peeaavaee ?11?
translation: Renouncing the worldly matters and shedding all attachment with worldly pleasures, he drinks deep the elixir that flows continuously in his (Dasam Duar) the celestial door of the body. (11)
